title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 257-5.1 - Definition
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 257-5.1 - Definition

State Regulations

Hydrogen sulfide (H
2
S) is a
colorless gas having a characteristic, disagreeable odor often described as
that of rotten eggs. For the purpose of this Subpart the term hydrogen sulfide
will include hydrogen sulfide and other sulfides as measured by the acceptable
analytical method. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
257-5.1

Renumbered from 257-10.1

New

York State Register November 27, 2019/Volume XLI, Issue 48, eff. 12/7/2019

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
